Control.Name: cmdbitmapChange
Control.Title: Change
Control.p: The Change option allows the editing of the icon filename.

Control.Name: cmdExport
Control.Title: Export
Control.p: The Export option allows the exporting of the new image to a selected location.

Control.Name: cmdImport
Control.Title: Import
Control.p: The import option allows for the loading of an existing icon from a selected location.

Control.Name: panEdit
Control.Title: Colours
Control.p: The toolbox allows for the changing of the colours, addition of text and shapes. It also allows for the moving of the icon around the button and also a preview of the button is displayed.

Control.Name: chkVKDisplayUnderlyingChars
Control.Title: Display Underlying Character Layouts
Control.p: If selected, then the visual keyboard will only be used if the current underlying layout is active.

Control.Name: chkVKInclude102key
Control.p: Display 102nd Key
On European Keyboards a 102nd key is added. This allows you to map a character on the 102nd key.

Control.Name: chkVKSplitCtrlAlt
Control.Title: Right Ctrl/Alt
Control.p: Allows for more combinations and also leaves the left Ctrl and Alt keys for general keyboard shortcuts, for example Ctrl C for Copy and Ctrl V for Paste.

Control.Name: cmdBrowseKeyBitmap
Control.Title: Browse button
Control.p: This allows for a bitmap/picture to be displayed on the selected key. Click on the Browse button to select the bitmap.

Control.Name: cmdExportOnScreenKeyboard
Control.Title: XML
Control.p: Export the keyboard to other file formats (HTML, BMP, or PNG), for use in documentation. Export the structure of the keyboard to XML format for automated processing.

Control.Name: cmdImportOnScreenKeyboard
Control.Title: Import
Control.p: Import an existing on screen keyboard layout.

Control.Name: cmdVKImportKMX
Control.Title: Layout
Control.p: Use the same layout as the new keyboard, assigning the same characters to the same keyboard letters.

Control.Name: editVKKeyText
Control.Title: Text
Control.p: Allows the user to enter text to be displayed on the selected key.

Control.Name: editFilter
Control.Title: Character Map Filter
Control.p: The Filter allows a user to reduce the number of characters displayed in the character map. The standard filter options used are by font name or block name.

Control.Name: grid
Control.Title: Character Map
Control.p: The Character Map Grid displays each character in a square, with a visual representation of the character and the Unicode value displayed at the bottom of the square. Each font group is divided into a block headed by the font name.

Control.Name: editName
Control.Title: Keyboard Name
Control.p: The name of the keyboard is displayed in Keyman Configuration, in the tray menu and in many other places. It should be a descriptive name, in any language, but remember that some applications may use a font that does not include the language you are writing the keyboard name in. Don't include a version number, help information or hotkey in the name.
This corresponds to the following source line:

Control.Name: cbType
Control.Title: Character Set
Control.p: Your keyboard should be either Unicode or Codepage based. Most keyboards today will be Unicode. If you are designing in the source editor, you can create a keyboard that is includes both Unicode and Codepage (or "ANSI") rules.
This corresponds to either of the following source lines:
Control.div:
begin ANSI > use(main)
begin Unicode > use(main)

Control.Name: editCopyright
Control.Title: Copyright
Control.p: Copyright details for the keyboard are displayed when the keyboard is installed. They can also be viewed in Keyman Configuration.
This corresponds to the following source line:

Control.Name: editMessage
Control.Title: Message
Control.p: The message provides some additional information to a user of your keyboard, when they install the keyboard.
This corresponds to the following source line:
Control.div: store(&message) 'Here is a message about a keyboard'

Control.Name: memoComments
Control.Title: Comments
Control.p: In this field, enter information about the keyboard for your own reference. These comments will only be visible in the source file, and not to users of your keyboard.
The comments are placed at the top of the source file, e.g.:
Control.div:
c Version 1.2 - fixed a bug with the 'k' key
c Version 1.1 - improved matching on vowels
c Version 1.0 - initial version

Control.Name: editKeyOutputText
Control.Title: Output Character(s)
Control.p: To select another key in the keyboard, either:

ul.li: Click on the key with the mouse, or
Press and release the Ctrl key to choose with the keyboard

Control.Name: chkKMWRTL
Control.Title: Keyboard is right-to-left
Control.p: Select this option to tell KeymanWeb to flag text entered by this keyboard as right-to-left (e.g. Arabic, Hebrew)

Control.Name: editKMWHelpText
Control.Title: Help Text
Control.p: A simple line of text to show under the On Screen Keyboard in KeymanWeb. Can contain HTML formatting and links. Mutually exclusive with the Help File box

Control.Name: editKMWHelpFile
Control.Title: Help File
Control.p: More complex help can be included by including an external file. See the European Latin keyboard in Samples for a comprehensive example.

Control.Name: cmdKMWBrowseHelpFile
Control.Title: Browse Help File
Control.p: Choose a help file to include in the keyboard

Control.Name: cmdCompileKeymanWeb
Control.Title: Compile to Web
Control.p: Compiles the keyboard for KeymanWeb. Two output files will be generated: [filename].js and [filename]_load.js. The KeymanWeb Tutorial contains more information about the difference between the two output files.

Control.Name: cmdTestKeymanWeb
Control.Title: Test KeymanWeb Keyboard
Control.p: Tests your KeymanWeb keyboard in an Internet Explorer embedded window

Control.Name: chkCustomOnScreenKeyboard
Control.Title: Include
Control.p: A custom on screen (visual) keyboard can be included with your new keyboard. Check this option to display the on screen keyboard and options available.

Control.Name: chkLayoutDisplay102key
Control.Title: European Keyboards
Control.p: On European Keyboards a 102nd key is added. This allows you to map a character on the 102nd key.

Control.Name: chkIncludeTaskbarIcon
Control.Title: Taskbar
Control.p: This option allows the user to choose whether the keyboard icon is displayed on the taskbar and to customise the look of the icon. Check the Include Icon on the Taskbar to display the icon bitmap editor.

Control.Name: chkSplitCtrlAlt
Control.Title: Right Ctrl/Alt
Control.p: Allows for more combinations and also leaves the left Ctrl and Alt keys for general keyboard shortcuts, for example Ctrl C for Copy and Ctrl V for Paste.

Control.Name: cmdAddToProject
Control.Title: Project
Control.p: This option adds the keyboard to the current active project.

Control.Name: cmdCompile
Control.Title: Compile Keyboard
Control.p: Select this option to begin the compiling of the keyboard. The success of the compile is displayed at the bottom of the screen. If errors are displayed, click on the Start Debugging button.

Control.Name: cmdInsertCopyright
Control.p: Insert Copyright
This allows for the insertion of a copyright symbol if needed.

Control.Name: cmdInstall
Control.Title: Install
Control.p: Install the compiled keyboard on to the computer.

Control.Name: lbDebugHosts
Control.Title: Debug Hosts
Control.p: To test on other platforms, open one of the debug host addresses on your device. Your device will need to be on the same network as this computer.
You can test within the web browser on your device, or in the native app if you have it installed: just click the Install button on the debugger web page.

Control.Name: cmdSendURLsToEmail
Control.Title: Send URLs to Email
Control.p: The Send to email function makes it easier to open the addresses on your mobile device without having to enter them manually.

Control.Name: cmdOpenContainingFolder2
Control.Title: Open Containing Folder
Control.p: This option will open the folder that contains all the files saved for the new keyboard project.

Control.Name: cmdStartDebugging
Control.Title: Start Debugging
Control.p: This option will allow for the debugging of a keyboard that could not be compiled and specific errors are displayed. It will direct the user to the source code of the keyboard file.

Control.Name: cmdUninstall
Control.Title: Uninstall
Control.p: Uninstall the keyboard from the computer.

Control.Name: cmdUpload
Control.Title: Upload
Control.p: This option allows the user to upload the compiled keyboard to Tavultesoft website to allow the sharing of the keyboard files.

Control.Name: cmdVKChange
Control.Title: Change
Control.p: The change button allows the change of the filename and/or location of the on screen keyboard.

Control.Name: editCharacterSet
Control.Title: Unicode
Control.p: Your keyboard should be either Unicode or Codepage based. Most keyboards today will be Unicode. If you are designing in the source editor, you can create a keyboard that is includes both Unicode and Codepage (or "ANSI") rules.
This corresponds to either of the following source lines:
begin ANSI > use(main)
begin Unicode > use(main)

Control.Name: editComments
Control.Title: Message
Control.p: The message provides some additional information to a user of your keyboard, when they install the keyboard.
This corresponds to the following source line:
store(&message) 'Here is a message about a keyboard''

Control.Name: editCopyright
Control.Title: Keyman Configuration
Control.p: Copyright details for the keyboard are displayed when the keyboard is installed. They can also be viewed in Keyman Configuration.

Control.Name: editKeyOutputCode
Control.Title: Unicode Character Value
Control.p: If the Unicode value is known, enter the value and the corresponding character will be displayed on the key.

Control.Name: editMessage
Control.Title: Message
Control.p: To add additional details about the keyboard. The message will be displayed when the keyboard is selected in Keyman Configuration.

Control.Name: editOuputCharacters
Control.Title: Release
Control.p: To select another key in the keyboard, either:
Click on the key with the mouse, or
Press and release the Ctrl key to choose with the keyboard

Control.Name: editVKFileName
Control.p: KVK Filename
Displays the file path and file name of the Keyman Visual Keyboard (KVK). Press the END key on your keyboard to view the filename or click on the Change button to change the filename and location.

Control.Title: TIKE Debugger 'Include Debug Information' Confirmation Screen
Control.p: TIKE Debugger

Debug information must be included in the compile keyboard before the debugger process can be started. From the Keyboard menu select Include Debug Information. The debug information will display the error sources when compiling.
The debugger can be used without the debug information by clicking on Test without debugger.

Control.Title: New File
Control.p: Enter the name for your new keyboard. Click on the Browse button to change the location of the new keyboard.

Control.Name: cbImageFile
Control.Title: Image File
Control.p: You can include an image file that will be displayed to the left of the install details when the package is installed. This image should be 140 pixels wide and 250 pixels high.

Control.Name: cbReadmeFile
Control.Title: Readme file
Control.p: The readme file can be displayed after the installation of the keyboard package, but can also be accessed from the keyboard folder at a later time. The file must be loaded under the Files tab, add option before being able to be selected from the drop down list.

Control.Name: chkCreateStartMenu
Control.Title: Start menu
Control.p: This option will allow you to create a folder on the Start menu when the keyboard package is installed.

Control.Name: chkStartMenuUninstall
Control.Title: Uninstall
Control.p: The uninstall shortcut will be added automatically to the shortcut menu list when the package is installed.

Control.Name: cmdAddFile
Control.Title: Add Files
Control.p: This option allows the user to add new files to the package.

Control.Name: cmdDeleteStartMenuEntry
Control.Title: Delete
Control.p: To delete the selected shortcut menu item from the Start menu folder.

Control.Name: cmdInsertCopyright
Control.Title: Insert Copyright
Control.p: This allows for the insertion of a copyright symbol if needed.

Control.Name: cbReadMe
Control.Title: Read Me Details
Control.p: A readme file can be a text file (ANSI, UTF-8, or UTF-16), or an HTML file (recommended). Other file types are also acceptable, but the package installer will load the file in a separate program.

Control.Name: cbKMPImageFile
Control.Title: Package Image
Control.p: You can include an image file that will be displayed to the left of the install details when the package is installed. This image should be 140 pixels wide and 250 pixels high.

Control.Name: cmdTestPackage
Control.Title: Test Package
Control.p: You should try installing your package on your system before distributing it, to ensure that all files are installed correctly. If you can, try installing your package on several different machines.

Control.Name: editOutPath
Control.Title: Compile
Control.p: Displays the output path and filename of the file when the package is compiled.

Control.Name: cmdCompileInstaller
Control.Title: Compile Installer
Control.p: Creates a self-extracting installer consisting of the package plus Keyman Desktop or another Keyman Engine product that was created with the Branding Pack.

Control.Name: editInstallerOutputFilename
Control.Title: Installer Output Filename
Control.p: Displays the output filename and path for the self-extract installer.

Control.Name: cmdInstallWith
Control.Title: Select Product Installer
Control.p: Chooses a product installer, such as the Keyman Desktop installation source. You can download Keyman Desktop installers from tavultesoft.com.

Control.Name: cmdAddToProject
Control.Title: Add to Project
Control.p: This option allows the user to add the compile package to the project, keeping all files together in the one location.

Control.Name: cmdBuildPackage
Control.Title: Compile Package
Control.p: This option checks the package has all the required files and for any errors. The success of the compilation is displayed at the bottom of the screen.

Control.Name: cmdInstall
Control.Title: Install Package
Control.p: This option will install the package on the computer. A message will be displayed as to the success of the install.

Control.Name: cmdNewStartMenuEntry
Control.Title: New
Control.p: To add a new menu item to the list of shortcuts to be displayed in the Start menu folder created when the keyboard package is installed.

Control.Name: cmdOpenContainingFolder
Control.Title: Open Containing Folder
Control.p: Opens the source folder of the selected file.

Control.Name: cmdOpenContainingFolder2
Control.Title: Open Containing Folder
Control.p: This option will open the folder the selected package is located in.

Control.Name: cmdOpenFile
Control.Title: Edit
Control.p: This option allows the user to edit the selected file if the appropriate editor is available.

Control.Name: cmdRemoveFile
Control.Title: Remove Files
Control.p: This option allows the user to remove a selected file from the list.

Control.Name: cmdUninstall
Control.Title: Uninstall Package
Control.p: This option will uninstall the package from the computer. A message will be displayed as to the success of the uninstall.

Control.Name: cmdUpload
Control.Title: Upload
Control.p: This option will enable the developer to upload the package to the Tavultesoft website.

Control.Name: editFilePath
Control.Title: Path
Control.p: Displays the location of the selected file.

Control.Name: editFileType
Control.p: File Type
Enter the details of the file type being added to the keyboard package.

Control.Name: editInfoAuthor
Control.Title: Author's
Control.p: Enter the name of the author or authors of the keyboard package.

Control.Name: editInfoCopyright
Control.Title: Copyright
Control.p: Enter the copyright details of the keyboard package This information will be displayed with the version, author and message information when the package is installed.

Control.Name: editInfoEmail
Control.Title: Email address
Control.p: Enter the contact email address for the keyboard package.

Control.Name: editInfoName
Control.Title: Package Name
Control.p: Package Name is the name that will be displayed when the package is installed. It should be a descriptive name, in any language, but remember that some applications may use a font that does not include the language you are writing the keyboard name in. Don't include a version number, help information or hotkey in the name.

Control.Name: editInfoVersion
Control.Title: Package Version
Control.p: The version number allows the user to check whether they have the latest version of the keyboard. The format should be 'major.minor[.subversion]'. Each number should be an integer, and you should avoid non-integer version strings. See help for more details.

Control.Name: editInfoWebSite
Control.Title: Website
Control.p: The website details for the keyboard package if available.

Control.Name: editStartMenuDescription
Control.Title: Start
Control.p: The text to be displayed for the selected file as a menu item in the Start up folder that is created when the package is installed.

Control.Name: editStartMenuPath
Control.p: Start Menu Path
Enter the path of the start menu to be displayed when the keyboard package is installed.

Control.Name: lbFiles
Control.Title: Package Files
Control.p: This will display all the files that have been added to the keyboard package. It allows for the addition and removal of files, the entering of file details and the editing of any of the files listed if the appropriate editor is available.

Control.Name: memoFileDetails
Control.Title: Details
Control.p: This option allows the user to enter details and other additional information about the selected file.

Control.Title: Project Manager
Control.p: The Project Manager allows you to manage all the files related to a keyboard layout in a single location.
